snippet: A radio station in Arkansas that ignited the careers of several musical greats before shutting down in 1960 is being revived by a community college, which hopes its return will lift the local economy.
abstract: KWEM radio station in West Memphis, Ark, which ignited careers of musical greats such as B B King, Jerry Lee Lewis and Howlin' Wolf before shutting down in 1960, is being revived by Mid-South Community College; community is hoping efforts to resurrect station will help lift local economy.
lead_paragraph: A radio station in Arkansas that ignited the careers of several musical greats before shutting down in 1960 is being revived by a community college, which hopes its return will lift the local economy.

headline.seo: KWEM’s Return Has West Memphis Reliving Its Role in Radio History
headline.main: Emerging From the Shadows Cast Across a River
headline.print_headline: Emerging From the Shadows Cast Across a River
